newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian MinFins rise further ahead of new Eurobond.
newsitem.headline: Russian MinFins rise further ahead of new Eurobond.

text.p: Prices of Russian MinFin bonds rose further on bank and investor Eurobond excitement ahead of an issue by Russia and enthusiasm from Moscow city government's successful debut this week, dealers said on Friday.
"Prices are rising and most people link that to Russia's forthcoming Eurobond. Moscow's Eurobond was also a good push," Moscow Business World bank dealer Sergei Kovzharov said.

The City of Moscow launched a $500 million three-year Eurobond on Tuesday. Russia plans a dollar-denominated Eurobond with at least a seven year maturity for the second half of June, with a roadshow scheduled for June 11-18.
Dealers said demand was seen domestically and abroad.
They the market was most interested in the sixth and fifth tranches.
"The West has been buying the whole week," one dealer said. He said local banks were trying to fix profits in the morning but switched positions later when the market continued to rise.
